Comments_List: Youre able to apply Spanish frequently through writing assignments, essays, oral evaluations, out of class recordings, etc. I grew immensely in my confidence to communicate in Spanish after taking this class.
Lots of improvement speaking and listening. A little improvement writing. Lots of vocab but super specific to the stories we read > didnt retain most of it
I improved my writing and conversational spanish, but also my daily academic/study habits.
I improved my writing and speaking skills.

speaking Spanish comfortably, quickly, clearly
reading different texts
a bunch of useful vocabulary
reading a short novel
Very skills based!

Strengths: the speaking parts (video homework, in class discussion and presentation)

Weaknesses: written homework on discussion forum

Strengths:
the professor
small class size
3 meetings per week

Weaknesses:
The workload was hard to keep up with by late semester
the textbook at times felt dated

Strengths:
lots of small group discussions
learning vocab consistently
effective review of some grammar without making it too big a deal
some really fun classroom activities
clear feedback

Weaknesses:
conversations could be forced, like any language class, but this one handled this well
teacher could be sticklerish but in the end I quite liked her
Yes, if a student wants to better their ability and confidence to communicate in a Spanish, this course is  needed.

Yes but only if willing to put in some work. There are easier and more interesting L5s but I really wanted to improve my speaking skills, and I think I was able to do that in 150. A lecture will never do that for you.
I would definitely recommend this course.

Totally - a really good way to get consistent Spanish conversation in throughout the semester without overextending. Good if you can communicate complex ideas in Spanish but want to increase fluency. I liked my classmates and so enjoyed the small group discussions.
